page.title: 19HUMSHAUGH HOPES AND FEARS
page.content: FEAR OF{NUCLEAR WAR}IS THE MOST COMMON WORRY IN THE COMMUNITY, ALTHOUGH COUPLED WITH THE HOPE THAT THE THREAT MAY BE AVERTED AND THAT THE CHILDREN (AND THEIR CHILDREN IN TURN) WILL GROW UP INTO A PEACEFUL WORLD WHERE THEY CAN BE USEFULLY EMPLOYED. WORK AND THE LACK OF IT ARE THE OTHER RECURRING FEARS;{REDUNDANCY}IS A CONSTANT DREAD, AND THE WORRIES OF LONG DISTANCES TO BE TRAVELLED TO WORK AND THE INSECURITY OF THE TIED HOUSE, ARE MUCH IN MIND. THERE IS ALSO ANXIETY ABOUT THE CONTINUING INTEGRITY OF{FAMILIES;}THE FEAR OF GROWN CHILDREN'S MARRIAGES BREAKING UP IS PARALLELED BY THE FEAR OF YOUNGER CHILDREN TURNING TO{DRUGS, AND THERE IS A RECURRING BUT LESS PRONOUNCED FEAR OF DEPENDENCE IN OLD AGE - OF HAVING TO RELY ON WHAT FAMILY REMAINS.
